TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TemplatedWizardStep extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase

Docs.summary: Represents a step in a wizard control that can be customized through the use of templates.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The TemplatedWizardStep class is provided to enable developers to apply a template to the steps in a control that acts as a wizard. The TemplatedWizardStep class is intended to be used primarily by control developers.
You can apply a theme to TemplatedWizardStep.
## Examples The TemplatedWizardStep class allows you to customize the content and navigation templates within it. The following example shows how to define a template-based wizard step.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatedWizardStep.CustomNavigationTemplate%2A> property allows you to take full control of the navigation block, usually displayed at the bottom of the current view. Normally, you fill the navigation block with a series of buttons. However, other controls are acceptable as long as they support command bubbling, as does the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button> control.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatedWizardStep#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_129_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatedWizardStep#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_129_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Web.UI.ITemplate ContentTemplate { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the template for displaying the content of a step in a control.
Docs.value: An object that contains the template for displaying the content of a step in a control.

Docs.summary: Gets the container that a control uses to create a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatedWizardStep.ContentTemplate%2A> template for a step.
Docs.value: A that contains the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatedWizardStep.ContentTemplate%2A> template for a step.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Although the syntax includes setting the ContentTemplateContainer property, it is for internal use only, so the property is effectively read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Web.UI.ITemplate CustomNavigationTemplate { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the template for displaying the navigation user interface (UI) of a step in a control.
Docs.value: An object that contains the template for displaying the navigation UI of a step in a control.

Docs.summary: Gets the container that a control uses to create a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatedWizardStep.CustomNavigationTemplate%2A> template for a step.
Docs.value: A that contains the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatedWizardStep.CustomNavigationTemplate%2A> template for a step.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Although the syntax includes setting the CustomNavigationTemplateContainer property, it is for internal use only, so the property is effectively read-only. Your code should verify that the CustomNavigationTemplateContainer property is not `null` before referencing it.
This property is not bindable in visual designers, but is bindable at runtime. For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.BindableAttribute>.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string SkinID { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the skin to apply to the control.
Docs.value: The name of the skin to apply to the control. The default is <xref:System.String>.
